channel.title: Lost Votes
channel.description:
A while ago I cut all contact with the user known on these forums as "danielmedveczk" Profile link: [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=245208]http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=245208[/url] He changed the toplist spot we had for the server "XlightcoreX" Link: http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?server=xlightcorex.no-ip.info Now he has changed it to "Codeusa Software" And all the votes have carried over.. He does still have access to the page but he cannot change the IP .. As I have spoke with him on Skype If anything could be done about this I would appreciate it Thanks Scott [size=14pt][b]***EDIT***[/b][/size] [size=14pt][b]I have now contacted No-IP Support [/b][/size]
Thank you for using the No-IP.com Support Ticket System. This is a confirmation that a Support Ticket has been created for your query. Someone from our Support team will look into the problem you have reported and contact you shortly. Your ticket number is: ###### Please keep this email handy so that you can check on the status of your request at: Again, Please do not reply to this email, this email was sent from an un-monitored account. If you need to add information to your ticket please do so by clicking the ticket link contained in this email. http://www.no-ip.com/members/ticket/view.php?ticket=##### Regards,No-IP Support Team

item.title: Lost Votes
item.dc:creator: @Scotticus Scotticus
item.description:
@Scotticus wrote:

Now that the server with the .info TLD Was removed… Do I get any votes back from the lost votes?

Read full topic

item.title: Lost Votes
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Anc13ntsIsBack:

@Moparisthebest - What if someone setup their domain and set the IP to their PC. Then once they had it activated (Their status page from confirming they had access). Then they switched the No-IP DNS to a different server? Would that actually work?

Yes, that would work, all the check is for is to confirm you have access to the domain name, nothing else.

Read full topic

item.title: Lost Votes
item.dc:creator: @danielmedveczk danielmedveczk
item.description:
@danielmedveczk wrote:

I think Scott that we had a long break now.
Aswell, i have thinked and thinked about what i did.

Hope we can discouss things when i get home on skype.
And figure something out. As you can see i have been watching lightcore for months and i could see that it went down from 200 players to 20.
I would love to help you get it back up again, and talk about the things i did wrong, and explain why i did it.

Hope we can speak about it.

Regards Daniel.

Read full topic

item.title: Lost Votes
item.dc:creator: @Anc13ntsIsBack Anc13ntsIsBack
item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

@Moparisthebest - What if someone setup their domain and set the IP to their PC. Then once they had it activated (Their status page from confirming they had access). Then they switched the No-IP DNS to a different server? Would that actually work?

Read full topic

item.title: Lost Votes
item.dc:creator: @Scotticus Scotticus
item.description:
@Scotticus wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Are you saying that is your IP that someone else posted? They must have had physical access to the server at the time, otherwise, they wouldn’t have been able to post it.

The No-IP Was on a shared account that I now have regained access to, The .info No-IP Was removed from that account and added on another… Hence why I have contacted No-IP Support

Thanks for the reply

Scott

Read full topic

item.title: Lost Votes
item.dc:creator: @Scotticus Scotticus
item.description:
@Scotticus wrote:

A while ago I cut all contact with the user known on these forums as “danielmedveczk” Profile link: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=245208

He changed the toplist spot we had for the server “XlightcoreX” Link: http://www.moparisthebest.com/serverstatus.php?server=xlightcorex.no-ip.info

Now he has changed it to “Codeusa Software” And all the votes have carried over…

He does still have access to the page but he cannot change the IP … As I have spoke with him on Skype

If anything could be done about this I would appreciate it

Thanks

Scott

[size=14pt]EDIT[/size]

[size=14pt]I have now contacted No-IP Support
[/size]
